Dick Cheney made a surprise appearance Thursday at the Conservative Political Action Committee Convention to present the former two-time defense secretary an award. The vice president joked that Donald Rumsfeld twice served as defense secretary and added that maybe if we give him a third term, he might get it right. Dick Cheney also drew laughs when he wondered aloud if Donald Rumsfeld may have more influence on Mr. Barack Obama than the president's current advisers. Bernie Sanders quote!): Now, Republicans not only have made Mr. Ryan chairman of the House Budget Committee, but on Tuesday the House is expected to vote to give him unprecedented powers to force spending cuts for the current fiscal year. That authority will allow Mr. Ryan to act unilaterally in setting an overall spending level for the rest of the year, a job usually handled by his full panel.... "Up until this point, the Republican leadership has been vague about what federal programs they want to cut, said Sen. Bernie Sanders , a Vermont independent who caucuses with Democrats. "On the other hand, Congressman Ryan has been very clear on this subject."" If the picture still isn't clear enough,

Donald Rumsfeld 's account highlights how high-profile security cooperation complicated US-Uzbek relations, said Sean Roberts , an international relations professor at George Washington University. Prior to 9/11, George Washington was able to engage the country's civil society and scant independent media with modest resources in order to promote long-term opening up in the country, Sean Roberts said. "Once the Defense Department raised the level of engagement on security issues, this inevitably forced the issue George Washington taking a more forthright stance on human rights issues as well. GOOG) announced a major shift to the executive ranks, calling it a way to streamline decision making and create clearer lines of responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. The details: Starting April 4, co-founder Larry Page, becomes CEO and takes over day-to-day operations. Co-founder Sergey Brin will focus on strategic projects, specifically, new products.
